AffineTransform getType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Method returns type of affine transformation. Transform matrix is   m00 m01 m02   m10 m11 m12 According analytic geometry new basis vectors are (m00, m01) and (m10, m11), translation vector is (m02, m12). Original basis vectors are (1, 0) and (0, 1). Type transformations classification: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_IDENTITY"><code>TYPE_IDENTITY</code></a> - new basis equals original one and zero translation</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_TRANSLATION"><code>TYPE_TRANSLATION</code></a> - translation vector isn't zero</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_UNIFORM_SCALE"><code>TYPE_UNIFORM_SCALE</code></a> - vectors length of new basis equals</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_GENERAL_SCALE"><code>TYPE_GENERAL_SCALE</code></a> - vectors length of new basis doesn't equal</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_FLIP"><code>TYPE_FLIP</code></a> - new basis vector orientation differ from original one</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_QUADRANT_ROTATION"><code>TYPE_QUADRANT_ROTATION</code></a> - new basis is rotated by 90, 180, 270, or 360 degrees</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_GENERAL_ROTATION"><code>TYPE_GENERAL_ROTATION</code></a> - new basis is rotated by arbitrary angle</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_GENERAL_TRANSFORM"><code>TYPE_GENERAL_TRANSFORM</code></a> - transformation can't be inversed</li></ul></div><pre>public int getType()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#getType--

AlphabetNumbering	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a general class for alphabet numbering. You can specify an alphabet and convert an integer into the corresponding alphabet number representation. BarcodeDataMatrix setHeight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the height of the barcode. If the height is zero it will be calculated. This height doesn't include the whitespace border, if any. <p></p> The allowed dimensions are (height, width):<p> 10, 10<br> 12, 12<br> 8, 18<br> 14, 14<br> 8, 32<br> 16, 16<br> 12, 26<br> 18, 18<br> 20, 20<br> 12, 36<br> 22, 22<br> 16, 36<br> 24, 24<br> 26, 26<br> 16, 48<br> 32, 32<br> 36, 36<br> 40, 40<br> 44, 44<br> 48, 48<br> 52, 52<br> 64, 64<br> 72, 72<br> 80, 80<br> 88, 88<br> 96, 96<br> 104, 104<br> 120, 120<br> 132, 132<br> 144, 144<br/></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></p></div><pre>public void setHeight(int height)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/barcodes/BarcodeDataMatrix.html#setHeight-int-
BarcodeDataMatrix setOptions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the options for the barcode generation. The options can be:<p> One of:<br><code>DM_AUTO</code> - the best encodation will be used<br><code>DM_ASCII</code> - ASCII encodation<br><code>DM_C40</code> - C40 encodation<br><code>DM_TEXT</code> - TEXT encodation<br><code>DM_B256</code> - binary encodation<br><code>DM_X21</code> - X21 encodation<br><code>DM_EDIFACT</code> - EDIFACT encodation<br><code>DM_RAW</code> - no encodation. The bytes provided are already encoded and will be added directly to the barcode, using padding if needed. It assumes that the encodation state is left at ASCII after the last byte.<br><p></p> One of:<br><code>DM_EXTENSION</code> - allows extensions to be embedded at the start of the text:<p> exxxxxx - ECI number xxxxxx<br> m5 - macro 5<br> m6 - macro 6<br> f - FNC1<br> saabbccccc - Structured Append, aa symbol position (1-16), bb total number of symbols (2-16), ccccc file identification (0-64515)<br> p - Reader programming<br> . - extension terminator<p> Example for a structured append, symbol 2 of 6, with FNC1 and ECI 000005. The actual text is "Hello".<p> s020600075fe000005.Hello<p> One of:<br><code>DM_TEST</code> - doesn't generate the image but returns all the other information.</br></p></p></p></br></br></br></br></br></br></p></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></p></div><pre>public void setOptions(int options)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/barcodes/BarcodeDataMatrix.html#setOptions-int-
BarcodeDataMatrix setWidth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the width of the barcode. If the width is zero it will be calculated. BarcodeInter25	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Implements the code interleaved 2 of 5. The text can include non numeric characters that are printed but do not generate bars. BlockRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from interface: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-">IRenderer</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. Border	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Represents a border.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/Border.html
Border draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div><pre>public abstract void draw(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas">PdfCanvas</a> canvas, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float borderWidthBefore, float borderWidthAfter)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/Border.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

CFFFontSubset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This Class subsets a CFF Type Font. The subset is preformed for CID fonts and NON CID fonts. The Charstring is subsetted for both types. For CID fonts only the FDArray which are used are embedded. The Lsubroutines of the FDArrays used are subsetted as well. The Subroutine subset supports both Type1 and Type2 formatting although only tested on Type2 Format. For Non CID the Lsubroutines are subsetted. On both types the Gsubroutines is subsetted. A font which was not of CID type is transformed into CID as a part of the subset process. The CID synthetic creation was written by Sivan Toledo (sivan@math.tau.ac.il)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/CFFFontSubset.html

Canvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is used for adding content directly onto a specified PdfCanvas. Canvas does not know the concept of a page, so it can't reflow to a 'next' Canvas.  This class effectively acts as a bridge between the high-level layout API and the low-level kernel API.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html
Canvas close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Closes the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a>. Although not completely necessary in all cases, it is still recommended to call this method when you are done working with <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a> object, as due to some properties set there might be some 'hanging' elements, which are waiting other elements to be added and processed. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html#close--"><code>close()</code></a> tells the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a> that no more elements will be added and it is time to finish processing all the elements.</div><pre>public void close()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html#close--

CanvasTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class represents a single tag on a single piece of marked content.  In Tagged PDF, a tag is the basic structure unit for marking content. The tag structure and hierarchy is largely comparable to HTML. As in HTML, every tag type has a name, defined here in the role attribute. The tagging mechanism in Tagged PDF is extensible, so PDF creators can choose to create custom tags.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/CanvasTag.html

Cell	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Cell is one piece of data in an enclosing grid, the Table. This object is a BlockElement, giving it a number of visual layout properties.  A cell can act as a container for a number of layout elements; it can only contain other BlockElement objects or images. Other types of layout elements must be wrapped in a BlockElement.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Cell.html

CompareTool	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class provides means to compare two PDF files both by content and visually and gives the report of their differences.  For visual comparison it uses external tools: Ghostscript and ImageMagick, which should be installed on your machine. To allow CompareTool to use them, you need to pass either java properties or environment variables with names "gsExec" and "compareExec", which would contain the paths to the executables of correspondingly Ghostscript and ImageMagick tools.  CompareTool class was mainly designed for the testing purposes of iText in order to ensure that the same code produces the same PDF document. For this reason you will often encounter such parameter names as "outDoc" and "cmpDoc" which stand for output document and document-for-comparison. The first one is viewed as the current result, and the second one is referred as normal or ideal result. OutDoc is compared to the ideal cmpDoc. Therefore all reports of the comparison are in the form: "Expected ..., but was ...". This should be interpreted in the following way: "expected" part stands for the content of the cmpDoc and "but was" part stands for the content of the outDoc.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareArrays	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Simple method that compares two given PdfArrays by content. This is "deep" comparing, which means that all nested objects are also compared by content.</div><pre>public boolean compareArrays(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> outArray, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> cmpArray) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareArrays-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-
CompareTool compareBooleans	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Simple method that compares two given PdfBooleans.</div><pre>public boolean compareBooleans(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfBoolean.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfBoolean</a> outBoolean, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfBoolean.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfBoolean</a> cmpBoolean)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareBooleans-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfBoolean-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfBoolean-
CompareTool compareByCatalog	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two PDF documents by content starting from Catalog dictionary and then recursively comparing corresponding objects which are referenced from it. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents. <br/><br/> The main difference between this method and the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByContent-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareByContent(String, String, String, String)</code></a> methods is the return value. This method returns a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.CompareResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool.CompareResult</code></a> class instance, which could be used in code, however compareByContent methods in case of the differences simply return String value, which could only be printed. Also, keep in mind that this method doesn't perform visual comparison of the documents. <br/><br/> For more explanations about what is outDoc and cmpDoc see last paragraph of the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.CompareResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils">CompareTool.CompareResult</a> compareByCatalog(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDocument.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfDocument</a> outDocument, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDocument.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfDocument</a> cmpDocument) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-
CompareTool compareByContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method overload is used to compare two encrypted PDF documents. Document passwords are passed with outPass and cmpPass parameters. <br/><br/> Compares two PDF documents by content starting from page dictionaries and then recursively comparing corresponding objects which are referenced from them. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents. <br/><br/> Unlike <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument)</code></a> this method performs content comparison page by page and doesn't compare the tag structure, acroforms and all other things that doesn't belong to specific pages. <br/> When comparison by content is finished, if any differences were found, visual comparison is automatically started. For more info see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareVisually-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.util.Map-"><code>compareVisually(String, String, String, String, Map)</code></a>. <br/><br/> For more explanations about what is outPdf and cmpPdf see last paragraph of the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description.</div><pre>public <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> compareByContent(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> differenceImagePrefix, <a byte[] cmpPass) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/InterruptedException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">InterruptedException</a>, <a CompareTool compareVisually	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two documents visually. For the comparison two external tools are used: Ghostscript and ImageMagick. For more info about needed configuration for visual comparison process see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description. <br/> During comparison for every page of two documents an image file will be created in the folder specified by outPath absolute path. Then those page images will be compared and if there are any differences for some pages, another image file will be created with marked differences on it. <br/> It is possible to ignore certain areas of the document pages during visual comparison. This is useful for example in case if documents should be the same except certain page area with date on it. In this case, in the folder specified by the outPath, new pdf documents will be created with the black rectangles at the specified ignored areas, and visual comparison will be performed on these new documents.</div><pre>public <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> compareVisually(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> outPdf, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> cmpPdf, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> outPath, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> differenceImagePrefix, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Map.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">Map</a>&lt;<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Integer.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">Integer</a>,<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/List.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">List</a>&lt;<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/Rectangle.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.geom">Rectangle</a>&gt;&gt; ignoredAreas) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/InterruptedException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">InterruptedException</a>, <a CompareTool disableCachedPagesComparison	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Disables the default logic of pages comparison. This option makes sense only for <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument)</code></a> method. <p> By default, pages are treated as special objects and if they are met in the process of comparison, then they are not checked as objects, but rather simply checked that they has same page numbers in both documents. This behaviour is intended for the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByContent-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareByContent(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)</code></a> set of methods, because in them documents are compared in page by page basis. Thus, we don't need to check if pages are of the same content when they are met in comparison process, we are sure that we will compare their content or we have already compared them. <p> However, if you would use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument, com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument)</code></a> with default behaviour of pages comparison, pages won't be checked at all, every time when reference to the page dictionary is met, only page numbers will be compared for both documents. You can say that in this case, comparison will be performed for all document's catalog entries except /Pages (However in fact, document's page tree structures will be compared, but pages themselves - won't).</p></p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils">CompareTool</a> disableCachedPagesComparison()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#disableCachedPagesComparison--

CounterFactory	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Factory that creates a counter for every reader or writer class. You can implement your own counter and declare it like this: CounterFactory.getInstance().setCounter(new SysoCounter()); SysoCounter is just an example of a Counter implementation. It writes info about files being read and written to the System.out.  This functionality can be used to create metrics in a SaaS context.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/log/CounterFactory.html

DashedBorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Draws a border with dashes around the element it's been set to.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/DashedBorder.html
DashedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div><pre>public void draw(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas">PdfCanvas</a> canvas, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float borderWidthBefore, float borderWidthAfter)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/DashedBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

It mainly operates high-level operations e.g. setting page size and rotation, adding elements, and writing text at specific coordinates. It has no knowledge of the actual PDF concepts and syntax.  A Document's rendering behavior can be modified by extending DocumentRenderer and setting an instance of this newly created with setRenderer(com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DocumentRenderer).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Document.html

DottedBorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Draws a dotted border around the element it has been set to. Do note that this border draw square dots, if you want to draw round dots, see RoundDotsBorder.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/DottedBorder.html
DottedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div><pre>public void draw(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas">PdfCanvas</a> canvas, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float borderWidthBefore, float borderWidthAfter)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/DottedBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

ElementPropertyContainer setRelativePosition	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets values for a relative repositioning of the Element. Also has as a side effect that the Element's <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/property/Property.html#POSITION"><code>Property.POSITION</code></a> is changed to <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutPosition.html#RELATIVE"><code>relative</code></a>. The default implementation in <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/AbstractRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>AbstractRenderer</code></a> treats <code>left</code> and <code>top</code> as the most important values. Only if <code>left == 0</code> will <code>right</code> be used for the calculation; ditto for top vs. bottom.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/ElementPropertyContainer.html" title="type parameter in ElementPropertyContainer">T</a> setRelativePosition(float left, float top, float right, float bottom)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/ElementPropertyContainer.html#setRelativePosition-float-float-float-float-

Multiple call to this method will produce multiple lines. <p> The thickness of the line will be <code>thickness + thicknessMul * fontSize</code>. EncryptionProperties setPublicKeyEncryption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the certificate encryption options for the document. An array of one or more public certificates must be provided together with an array of the same size for the permissions for each certificate. The open permissions for the document can be AllowPrinting, AllowModifyContents, AllowCopy, AllowModifyAnnotations, AllowFillIn, AllowScreenReaders, AllowAssembly and AllowDegradedPrinting. The permissions can be combined by ORing them. Optionally DO_NOT_ENCRYPT_METADATA can be ORed to output the metadata in cleartext See <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionConstants.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>EncryptionConstants</code></a>.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">EncryptionProperties</a> setPublicKeyEncryption(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/security/cert/Certificate.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.security.cert">Certificate</a>[] certs, int[] permissions, int encryptionAlgorithm)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionProperties.html#setPublicKeyEncryption-java.security.cert.Certificate:A-int:A-int-
EncryptionProperties setStandardEncryption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the encryption options for the document. The userPassword and the ownerPassword can be null or have zero length. In this case the ownerPassword is replaced by a random string. The open permissions for the document can be ALLOW_PRINTING, ALLOW_MODIFY_CONTENTS, ALLOW_COPY, ALLOW_MODIFY_ANNOTATIONS, ALLOW_FILL_IN, ALLOW_SCREENREADERS, ALLOW_ASSEMBLY and ALLOW_DEGRADED_PRINTING. The permissions can be combined by ORing them. See <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionConstants.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>EncryptionConstants</code></a>.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">EncryptionProperties</a> setStandardEncryption(byte[] userPassword, byte[] ownerPassword, int permissions, int encryptionAlgorithm)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionProperties.html#setStandardEncryption-byte:A-byte:A-int-int-

FilteredEventListener attachEventListener	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Attaches another <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/IEventListener.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>IEventListener</code></a> delegate with its filters. When all the filters attached to the delegate for an event accept the event, the event will be passed on to the delegate. You can attach multiple delegates to this <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>FilteredEventListener</code></a> instance. The content stream will be parsed just once, so it is better for performance than creating multiple <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>FilteredEventListener</code></a> instances and parsing the content stream multiple times. FontProgramFactory	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Provides methods for creating various types of fonts.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types, a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1". This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic". <p></p> The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag <code>cached</code>. If the <code>byte</code> arrays are present the font will be read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify the font type. <p></p> Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#' followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br> The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph if not done with care.<br> The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise text justification will not work. <p></p> Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode character space, A, B and ecyrillic: <pre> "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454" </pre><p></p> Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font: <pre> "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020" </pre></br></br></div><pre>public static <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgram.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.io.font">FontProgram</a> createFont(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> name, byte[] font, boolean cached) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createFont-java.lang.String-byte:A-boolean-
FontProgramFactory createRegisteredFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>public static <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgram.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.io.font">FontProgram</a> createRegisteredFont(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> fontName, int style, boolean cached) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createRegisteredFont-java.lang.String-int-boolean-
FontProgramFactory createType1Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types, a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1". This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic". <p></p> The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag <code>cached</code>. If the <code>byte</code> arrays are present the font will be read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify the font type. <p></p> Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#' followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br> The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph if not done with care.<br> The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise text justification will not work. <p></p> Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode character space, A, B and ecyrillic: <pre> "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454" </pre><p></p> Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font: <pre> "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020" </pre></br></br></div><pre>public static <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgram.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.io.font">FontProgram</a> createType1Font(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> name, byte[] afm, byte[] pfb, boolean cached) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createType1Font-java.lang.String-byte:A-byte:A-boolean-

GlyphPositioningTableReader	A										<section class="prog__container"><p> Parses an OpenTypeFont file and reads the Glyph Substitution Table. This table governs how two or more Glyphs should be merged to a single Glyph. This is especially useful for Asian languages like Bangla, Hindi, etc.  This has been written according to the OPenTypeFont specifications. This may be found here. </p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/otf/GlyphPositioningTableReader.html

GreekAlphabetNumbering	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is responsible for converting integer numbers to their Greek alphabet letter representations. We are aware of the fact that the original Greek numbering is different. See http://www.cogsci.indiana.edu/farg/harry/lan/grknum.htm#ancient but this isn't implemented yet; the main reason being the fact that we need a font that has the obsolete Greek characters qoppa and sampi. So we use standard 24 letter Greek alphabet</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/numbering/GreekAlphabetNumbering.html

HashCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is a convenience method to sequentially calculate hash code of the object based on the field values. The result depends on the order of elements appended. The exact formula is the same as for java.util.List.hashCode. If you need order independent hash code just summate, multiply or XOR all elements.  Suppose we have class:  class Thing {     long id;     String name;     float weight; }  The hash code calculation can be expressed in 2 forms.  For maximum performance:  public int hashCode() {     int hashCode = HashCode.EMPTY_HASH_CODE;     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, id);     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, name);     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, weight);     return hashCode; }  For convenience:  public int hashCode() {     return new HashCode().append(id).append(name).append(weight).hashCode(); } </p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/util/HashCode.html
HashCode append	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Appends value's hashCode to the current hashCode.</div><pre>public final <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/util/HashCode.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.io.util">HashCode</a> append(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">Object</a> value)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/util/HashCode.html#append-java.lang.Object-
HashCode combine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Combines hashCode of previous elements sequence and value's hashCode.</div><pre>public static int combine(int hashCode, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">Object</a> value)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/util/HashCode.html#combine-int-java.lang.Object-
HashCode hashCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns accumulated hashCode</div><pre>public final int hashCode()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/util/HashCode.html#hashCode--

HyphenationTree	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This tree structure stores the hyphenation patterns in an efficient way for fast lookup. It provides the provides the method to hyphenate a word.This work was authored by Carlos Villegas (cav@uniscope.co.jp).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html
HyphenationTree addClass	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Add a character class to the tree. It is used by <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/PatternParser.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.hyphenation"><code>PatternParser</code></a> as callback to add character classes. Character classes define the valid word characters for hyphenation. If a word contains a character not defined in any of the classes, it is not hyphenated. It also defines a way to normalize the characters in order to compare them with the stored patterns. Usually pattern files use only lower case characters, in this case a class for letter 'a', for example, should be defined as "aA", the first character being the normalization char.</div><pre>public void addClass(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> chargroup)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#addClass-java.lang.String-

HyphenationTree packValues	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Packs the values by storing them in 4 bits, two values into a byte Values range is from 0 to 9. We use zero as terminator, so we'll add 1 to the value.</div><pre>protected int packValues(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> values)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#packValues-java.lang.String-
HyphenationTree searchPatterns	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p>Search for all possible partial matches of word starting at index an update interletter values. In other words, it does something like:</p><code> for(i=0; i<patterns.length; (="" )="" <="" code="" i++)="" if="" update_interletter_values(patterns[i]);="" word.substring(index).startswidth(patterns[i])="" {="" }=""><p>But it is done in an efficient way since the patterns are stored in a ternary tree. In fact, this is the whole purpose of having the tree: doing this search without having to test every single pattern. The number of patterns for languages such as English range from 4000 to 10000. Thus, doing thousands of string comparisons for each word to hyphenate would be really slow without the tree. The tradeoff is memory, but using a ternary tree instead of a trie, almost halves the the memory used by Lout or TeX. It's also faster than using a hash table</p></patterns.length;></code></div><pre>protected void searchPatterns(char[] word, int index, byte[] il)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#searchPatterns-char:A-int-byte:A-

IRandomAccessSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Represents an abstract source that bytes can be read from.  This class forms the foundation for all byte input in iText. Implementations do not keep track of a current 'position', but rather provide absolute get methods.  Tracking position should be handled in classes that use RandomAccessSource internally (via composition).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html

IRenderer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A renderer object is responsible for drawing a corresponding layout object on a document or canvas. Every layout object has a renderer, by default one of the corresponding type, e.g. you can ask an Image for its ImageRenderer.  Renderers are designed to be extensible, and custom implementations can be seeded to layout objects (or their custom subclasses) at runtime.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html

IRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#draw-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DrawContext-"><code>draw(DrawContext)</code></a>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.</div><pre><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutResult</a> layout(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutContext</a> layoutContext)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

ISO8601Converter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Converts between ISO 8601 Strings and Calendar with millisecond resolution.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ISO8601Converter.html
ISO8601Converter parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Converts an ISO 8601 string to an <code>XMPDateTime</code>.  Parse a date according to ISO 8601 and http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime: <ul><li>YYYY <li>YYYY-MM <li>YYYY-MM-DD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD </li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>  Data fields: <ul><li>YYYY = four-digit year <li>MM = two-digit month (01=January, etc.) <li>DD = two-digit day of month (01 through 31) <li>hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23) <li>mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) <li>ss = two digits of second (00 through 59) <li>s = one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second <li>TZD = time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm) </li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>  Note that ISO 8601 does not seem to allow years less than 1000 or greater than 9999. We allow any year, even negative ones. The year is formatted as "%.4d". <p><em>Note:</em> Tolerate missing TZD, assume is UTC. Photoshop 8 writes dates like this for exif:GPSTimeStamp.<br><em>Note:</em> DOES NOT APPLY ANYMORE. Tolerate missing date portion, in case someone foolishly writes a time-only value that way.</br></p></div><pre>public static <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPDateTime.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp">XMPDateTime</a> parse(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> iso8601String) throws <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPException.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp">XMPException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ISO8601Converter.html#parse-java.lang.String-
ISO8601Converter render	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Converts a <code>Calendar</code> into an ISO 8601 string. Format a date according to ISO 8601 and http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime: <ul><li>YYYY <li>YYYY-MM <li>YYYY-MM-DD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD </li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>  Data fields: <ul><li>YYYY = four-digit year <li>MM  = two-digit month (01=January, etc.) <li>DD  = two-digit day of month (01 through 31) <li>hh  = two digits of hour (00 through 23) <li>mm  = two digits of minute (00 through 59) <li>ss  = two digits of second (00 through 59) <li>s   = one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second <li>TZD         = time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm) </li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></ul><p><em>Note:</em> ISO 8601 does not seem to allow years less than 1000 or greater than 9999.  We allow any year, even negative ones. The year is formatted as "%.4d".<p><em>Note:</em> Fix for bug 1269463 (silently fix out of range values) included in parsing. The quasi-bogus "time only" values from Photoshop CS are not supported.</p></p></div><pre>public static <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> render(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPDateTime.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp">XMPDateTime</a> dateTime)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ISO8601Converter.html#render-com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.XMPDateTime-

Latin1Converter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/Latin1Converter.html
Latin1Converter convert	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A converter that processes a byte buffer containing a mix of UTF8 and Latin-1/Cp1252 chars. The result is a buffer where those chars have been converted to UTF-8;  that means it contains only valid UTF-8 chars. <p><em>Explanation of the processing:</em> First the encoding of the buffer is detected looking  at the first four bytes (that works only if the buffer starts with an ASCII-char,  like xmls &amp;apos;&lt;&amp;apos;). UTF-16/32 flavours do not require further proccessing. <p>  In the case, UTF-8 is detected, it assumes wrong UTF8 chars to be a sequence of  Latin-1/Cp1252 encoded bytes and converts the chars to their corresponding UTF-8 byte  sequence. <p>  The 0x80..0x9F range is undefined in Latin-1, but is defined in Windows code page 1252. The bytes 0x81, 0x8D, 0x8F, 0x90, and 0x9D are formally undefined by Windows 1252. These are in XML's RestrictedChar set, so we map them to a space.  <p> The official Latin-1 characters in the range 0xA0..0xFF are converted into the Unicode Latin Supplement range U+00A0 - U+00FF. <p><em>Example:</em> If an Euro-symbol (â¬) appears in the byte buffer (0xE2, 0x82, 0xAC),  it will be left as is. But if only the first two bytes are appearing,  followed by an ASCII char a (0xE2 - 0x82 - 0x41), it will be converted to  0xC3, 0xA2 (Ã¢) - 0xE2, 0x80, 0x9A (â) - 0x41 (a).</p></p></p></p></p></div><pre>public static <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ByteBuffer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.impl">ByteBuffer</a> convert(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ByteBuffer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.impl">ByteBuffer</a> buffer)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/Latin1Converter.html#convert-com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.impl.ByteBuffer-

Leading	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A specialized class that specifies the leading, "the vertical distance between the baselines of adjacent lines of text" (ISO-32000-1, section 9.3.5). Allows to use either an absolute (constant) leading value, or one determined by font size. Pronounce as 'ledding' (cfr. Led Zeppelin). This class is meant to be used as the value for the Property.LEADING key in an IPropertyContainer.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/property/Leading.html

LineSegment getBoundingRectange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span> <span class="deprecationComment">Use getBoundingRectangle(). Will be removed in 7.1</span></div><br><div class="block">Computes the bounding rectangle for this line segment.  The rectangle has a rotation 0 degrees with respect to the coordinate system that the line system is in. LineSeparatorRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#draw-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DrawContext-"><code>IRenderer.draw(DrawContext)</code></a>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutResult</a> layout(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutContext</a> layoutContext)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/LineSeparatorRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

ListItemRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from interface: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-">IRenderer</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. LocationTextExtractionStrategy isChunkAtWordBoundary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Determines if a space character should be inserted between a previous chunk and the current chunk. This method is exposed as a callback so subclasses can fine time the algorithm for determining whether a space should be inserted or not. By default, this method will insert a space if the there is a gap of more than half the font space character width between the end of the previous chunk and the beginning of the current chunk.  It will also indicate that a space is needed if the starting point of the new chunk appears *before* the end of the previous chunk (i.e. overlapping text).</div><pre>protected boolean isChunkAtWordBoundary(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener">LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk</a> chunk, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener">LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk</a> previousChunk)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/LocationTextExtractionStrategy.html#isChunkAtWordBoundary-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener.LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener.LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk-

OutputStreamAesEncryption finish	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>public void finish()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamAesEncryption.html#finish--
OutputStreamAesEncryption write	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes <code>len</code> bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset <code>off</code> to this output stream. The general contract for <code>write(b, off, len)</code> is that some of the bytes in the array <code>b</code> are written to the output stream in order; element <code>b[off]</code> is the first byte written and <code>b[off+len-1]</code> is the last byte written by this operation. <p></p> The <code>write</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> calls the write method of one argument on each of the bytes to be written out. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide a more efficient implementation. <p></p> If <code>b</code> is <code>null</code>, a <code>NullPointerException</code> is thrown. <p></p> If <code>off</code> is negative, or <code>len</code> is negative, or <code>off+len</code> is greater than the length of the array <code>b</code>, then an <tt>IndexOutOfBoundsException</tt> is thrown.</div><pre>public void write(byte[] b, int off, int len) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamAesEncryption.html#write-byte:A-int-int-
OutputStreamEncryption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html
OutputStreamEncryption close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Closes this output stream and releases any system resources associated with this stream. The general contract of <code>close</code> is that it closes the output stream. A closed stream cannot perform output operations and cannot be reopened. <p></p> The <code>close</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> does nothing.</div><pre>public void close() throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#close--
OutputStreamEncryption finish	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>public abstract void finish()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#finish--
OutputStreamEncryption flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes this output stream and forces any buffered output bytes to be written out. The general contract of <code>flush</code> is that calling it is an indication that, if any bytes previously written have been buffered by the implementation of the output stream, such bytes should immediately be written to their intended destination. <p></p> The <code>flush</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> does nothing.</div><pre>public void flush() throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#flush--
OutputStreamEncryption write	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes <code>len</code> bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset <code>off</code> to this output stream. The general contract for <code>write(b, off, len)</code> is that some of the bytes in the array <code>b</code> are written to the output stream in order; element <code>b[off]</code> is the first byte written and <code>b[off+len-1]</code> is the last byte written by this operation. <p></p> The <code>write</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> calls the write method of one argument on each of the bytes to be written out. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide a more efficient implementation. <p></p> If <code>b</code> is <code>null</code>, a <code>NullPointerException</code> is thrown. <p></p> If <code>off</code> is negative, or <code>len</code> is negative, or <code>off+len</code> is greater than the length of the array <code>b</code>, then an <tt>IndexOutOfBoundsException</tt> is thrown.</div><pre>public abstract void write(byte[] b, int off, int len) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#write-byte:A-int-int-

OutputStreamStandardEncryption write	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes <code>len</code> bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset <code>off</code> to this output stream. The general contract for <code>write(b, off, len)</code> is that some of the bytes in the array <code>b</code> are written to the output stream in order; element <code>b[off]</code> is the first byte written and <code>b[off+len-1]</code> is the last byte written by this operation. <p></p> The <code>write</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> calls the write method of one argument on each of the bytes to be written out. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide a more efficient implementation. <p></p> If <code>b</code> is <code>null</code>, a <code>NullPointerException</code> is thrown. <p></p> If <code>off</code> is negative, or <code>len</code> is negative, or <code>off+len</code> is greater than the length of the array <code>b</code>, then an <tt>IndexOutOfBoundsException</tt> is thrown.</div><pre>public void write(byte[] b, int off, int len) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamStandardEncryption.html#write-byte:A-int-int-

ParagraphRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#draw-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DrawContext-"><code>IRenderer.draw(DrawContext)</code></a>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutResult</a> layout(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutContext</a> layoutContext)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/ParagraphRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

PdfA3Checker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfA3Checker defines the requirements of the PDF/A-3 standard and contains a number of methods that override the implementations of its superclass PdfA2Checker.  The specification implemented by this class is ISO 19005-3</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/checker/PdfA3Checker.html
PdfA3Checker checkFileSpec	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>protected void checkFileSpec(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDictionary.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfDictionary</a> fileSpec)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/checker/PdfA3Checker.html#checkFileSpec-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDictionary-
PdfAChecker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An abstract class that will run through all necessary checks defined in the different PDF/A standards and levels. A number of common checks are executed in this class, while standard-dependent specifications are implemented in the available subclasses. The standard that is followed is the series of ISO 19005 specifications, currently generations 1 through 3. The ZUGFeRD standard is derived from ISO 19005-3.  While it is possible to subclass this method and implement its abstract methods in client code, this is not encouraged and will have little effect. It is not possible to plug custom implementations into iText, because iText should always refuse to create non-compliant PDF/A, which would be possible with client code implementations. Any future generations of the PDF/A standard and its derivates will get their own implementation in the iText 7 - pdfa project.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/checker/PdfAChecker.html

PdfADocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class extends PdfDocument and is in charge of creating files that comply with the PDF/A standard.  Client code is still responsible for making sure the file is actually PDF/A compliant: multiple steps must be undertaken (depending on the PdfAConformanceLevel) to ensure that the PDF/A standard is followed.  This class will throw exceptions, mostly PdfAConformanceException,  and thus refuse to output a PDF/A file if at any point the document does not adhere to the PDF/A guidelines specified by the PdfAConformanceLevel.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/PdfADocument.html

PdfAcroForm isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfAcroForm setDefaultResources	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the <code>DR</code> dictionary property on the AcroForm. <p><blockquote><code>DR</code> is a resource dictionary containing default resources (such as fonts, patterns, or colour spaces) that shall be used by form field appearance streams. At a minimum, this dictionary shall contain a Font entry specifying the resource name and font dictionary of the default font for displaying text. PdfAcroForm setGenerateAppearance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the attribute generateAppearance, which tells <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#flattenFields--"><code>flattenFields()</code></a> to generate an appearance Stream for all <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/fields/PdfFormField.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.forms.fields"><code>form field</code></a>s that don't have one. <p> Not generating appearances will speed up form flattening but the results can be unexpected in Acrobat. Don't use it unless your environment is well controlled. The default is <code>true</code>. <p> If generateAppearance is set to <code>true</code>, then <code>NeedAppearances</code> is set to <code>false</code>. This does not apply vice versa.</p></p></div><pre>public void setGenerateAppearance(boolean generateAppearance)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#setGenerateAppearance-boolean-

PdfAction flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfAction isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfAction.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfAnnotation getBorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> An array specifying the characteristics of the annotationâs border. The array consists of three numbers defining the horizontal corner radius, vertical corner radius, and border width, all in default user space units. If the corner radii are 0, the border has square (not rounded) corners; if the border width is 0, no border is drawn. <p> The array may have a fourth element, an optional dash array (see ISO-320001 8.4.3.6, âLine Dash Patternâ).</p></p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> getBorder()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorder--
PdfAnnotation getBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">The dictionaries for some annotation types (such as free text and polygon annotations) can include the BS entry. That entry specifies a border style dictionary that has more settings than the array specified for the Border entry (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorder--"><code>getBorder()</code></a>). If an annotation dictionary includes the BS entry, then the Border entry is ignored. If annotation includes AP (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getAppearanceDictionary--"><code>getAppearanceDictionary()</code></a>) it takes precedence over the BS entry. For more info on BS entry see ISO-320001, Table 166.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDictionary.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfDictionary</a> getBorderStyle()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorderStyle--
