PdfAnnotation getQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of 8 Ã n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals in default user space. Quadrilaterals are used to define: <ul><li>regions inside annotation rectangle in which the link annotation should be activated;</li><li>a word or group of contiguous words in the text underlying the text markup annotation;</li><li>the content region that is intended to be removed for a redaction annotation;</li></ul><p> IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> getQuadPoints()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getQuadPoints--

PdfAnnotation isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfAnnotation setFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a flag that specifies a characteristic of the annotation to enabled state (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ). On the contrary from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlags-int-"><code>setFlags(int)</code></a>, this method sets only specified flags to enabled state, but doesn't disable other flags. Possible flags: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#INVISIBLE"><code>INVISIBLE</code></a> - If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the     standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such unknown annotation     using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#HIDDEN"><code>HIDDEN</code></a> - If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with     the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#PRINT"><code>PRINT</code></a> - If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print     the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_ZOOM"><code>NO_ZOOM</code></a> - If set, do not scale the annotationâs appearance to match the magnification of     the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation     rectangle) shall remain fixed, regardless of the page magnification.}     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_ROTATE"><code>NO_ROTATE</code></a> - If set, do not rotate the annotationâs appearance to match the rotation     of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle shall remain in a fixed location on the page,     regardless of the page rotation.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_VIEW"><code>NO_VIEW</code></a> - If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact     with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered     hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#READ_ONLY"><code>READ_ONLY</code></a> -  If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation     may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse     clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#LOCKED"><code>LOCKED</code></a> -  If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties     (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to     the annotationâs contents, such as the value of a form field.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#TOGGLE_NO_VIEW"><code>TOGGLE_NO_VIEW</code></a> - If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#LOCKED_CONTENTS"><code>LOCKED_CONTENTS</code></a> - If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified     by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties,     such as position and size.     </li></ul></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfAnnotation</a> setFlag(int flag)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlag-int-
PdfAnnotation setFlags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ). On the contrary from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlag-int-"><code>setFlag(int)</code></a>, this method sets a complete set of enabled and disabled flags at once. PdfAnnotation setPage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Method that modifies annotation page property, which defines to which page annotation belongs. Keep in mind that this doesn't actually add an annotation to the page, it should be done via <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#addAnnotation-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot.PdfAnnotation-"><code>PdfPage.addAnnotation(PdfAnnotation)</code></a>. Also you don't need to set this property manually, this is done automatically on addition to the page.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfAnnotation</a> setPage(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfPage</a> page)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setPage-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-
PdfAnnotation setQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets n quadrilaterals in default user space by passing an <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>PdfArray</code></a> of 8 Ã n numbers. For more info of what quadrilaterals define see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getQuadPoints--"><code>getQuadPoints()</code></a>. <p> IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfAnnotation</a> setQuadPoints(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> quadPoints)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setQuadPoints-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-

PdfAnnotation setStructParentIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets he integer key of the annotationâs entry in the structural parent tree (see ISO-320001 14.7.4.4, âFinding Structure Elements from Content Itemsâ). PdfAnnotationAppearance isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotationAppearance.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfBorderArray isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfBorderArray.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfCanvasConstants.LineCapStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The line cap style specifies the shape to be used at the ends of open subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.  All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 8.4.3.3 "Line Cap Style".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvasConstants.LineCapStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The line join style specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths that are stroked. Join styles are significant only at points where consecutive segments of a path connect at an angle; segments that meet or intersect fortuitously receive no special treatment.  All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 8.4.3.4 "Line Join Style".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The text rendering mode determines whether showing text causes glyph outlines to be stroked, filled, used as a clipping boundary, or some combination of the three. Stroking, filling, and clipping have the same effects for a text object as they do for a path object, although they are specified in an entirely different way.  If the text rendering mode calls for filling, the current nonstroking color in the graphics state is used; if it calls for stroking, the current stroking color is used.  All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 9.3.6 "Text Rendering Mode".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode.html

PdfCanvasParser parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Parses a single command from the content. Each command is output as an array of arguments having the command itself as the last element. The returned array will be empty if the end of content was reached. <br> A specific behaviour occurs when inline image is encountered (BI command): in that case, parser would continue parsing until it meets EI - end of the inline image; as a result in this case it will return an array with inline image dictionary and image bytes encapsulated in PdfStream object as first element and EI command as second element.</br></div><pre>public <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/List.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">List</a>&lt;<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObject.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfObject</a>&gt; parse(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/List.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">List</a>&lt;<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObject.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfObject</a>&gt; ls) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/util/PdfCanvasParser.html#parse-java.util.List-

PdfCatalog getOCProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Use this method to get the <b>Optional Content Properties Dictionary</b>. Note that if you call this method, then the PdfDictionary with OCProperties will be generated from PdfOCProperties object right before closing the PdfDocument, so if you want to make low-level changes in Pdf structures themselves (PdfArray, PdfDictionary, etc), then you should address directly those objects, e.g.: <code> PdfCatalog pdfCatalog = pdfDoc.getCatalog(); PdfDictionary ocProps = pdfCatalog.getAsDictionary(PdfName.OCProperties); // manipulate with ocProps. </code> Also note that this method is implicitly called when creating a new PdfLayer instance, so you should either use hi-level logic of operating with layers, or manipulate low-level Pdf objects by yourself.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfOCProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.layer">PdfOCProperties</a> getOCProperties(boolean createIfNotExists)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfCatalog.html#getOCProperties-boolean-

PdfCieBasedCs flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfCieBasedCs.html#flush--
PdfCieBasedCs isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfCieBasedCs.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfCollectionField isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/collection/PdfCollectionField.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfCollectionItem isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/collection/PdfCollectionItem.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfDate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfDate is the PDF date object.  PDF defines a standard date format. The PDF date format closely follows the format defined by the international standard ASN.1 (Abstract Syntax Notation One, defined in CCITT X.208 or ISO/IEC 8824). A date is a PdfString of the form:  (D:YYYYMMDDHHmmSSOHH'mm')  This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual version 1.3' section 7.2 (page 183-184)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDate.html

PdfDeveloperExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Beginning with BaseVersion 1.7, the extensions dictionary lets developers designate that a given document contains extensions to PDF. The presence of the extension dictionary in a document indicates that it may contain developer-specific PDF properties that extend a particular base version of the PDF specification. The extensions dictionary enables developers to identify their own extensions relative to a base version of PDF. Additionally, the convention identifies extension levels relative to that base version. The intent of this dictionary is to enable developers of PDF-producing applications to identify company-specific specifications (such as this one) that PDF-consuming applications use to interpret the extensions.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDeveloperExtension.html

PdfDictionary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A representation of a Dictionary as described by the PDF Specification. A Dictionary is a mapping between keys and values. Keys are PdfNames and the values are PdfObjects. Each key can only be associated with one value and adding a new value to an existing key will override the previous value. A value of null should be ignored when the PdfDocument is closed.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDictionary.html
PdfDictionary clear	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Removes all key-value pairs from this PdfDictionary.</div><pre>public void clear()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDictionary.html#clear--

PdfDocumentInfo isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDocumentInfo.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfEncryption flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfEncryption isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfEncryption.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfExplicitDestination isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/navigation/PdfExplicitDestination.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfExtGState flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/extgstate/PdfExtGState.html#flush--

PdfFont flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. When set to <code>true</code> only the glyphs used will be included in the font. When set to <code>false</code> and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/font/PdfFont.html#addSubsetRange-int:A-"><code>addSubsetRange(int[])</code></a> was not called the full font will be included otherwise just the characters ranges will be included.</div><pre>public void setSubset(boolean subset)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/font/PdfFont.html#setSubset-boolean-

PdfFormField isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/fields/PdfFormField.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfFormXObject flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/function/PdfFunction.html#flush--

PdfFunction isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/function/PdfFunction.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfImageXObject identifyImageType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Identifies the type of the image that is stored in the bytes of this <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.xobject"><code>PdfImageXObject</code></a>. For instance, the return value of this method will never be <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#PNG"><code>ImageType.PNG</code></a> as we loose this information when converting a PNG image into something that can be put into a PDF file. PdfLayer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An optional content group is a dictionary representing a collection of graphics that can be made visible or invisible dynamically by users of viewer applications. In iText they are referenced as layers.  To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayer.html

PdfLayer addOCGRadioGroup	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Use this method to set a collection of optional content groups whose states are intended to follow a "radio button" paradigm. That is, the state of at most one optional content group in the array should be ON at a time: if one group is turned ON, all others must be turned OFF.</div><pre>public static void addOCGRadioGroup(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDocument.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfDocument</a> document, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/List.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">List</a>&lt;<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.layer">PdfLayer</a>&gt; group)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayer.html#addOCGRadioGroup-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-java.util.List-

PdfLayer isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayer.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfLayerMembership	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Content typically belongs to a single optional content group, and is visible when the group is ON and invisible when it is OFF. To express more complex visibility policies, content should not declare itself to belong to an optional content group directly, but rather to an optional content membership dictionary represented by this class.  To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayerMembership.html

PdfLayerMembership setVisibilityPolicy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the visibility policy for content belonging to this membership dictionary. Possible values are AllOn, AnyOn, AnyOff and AllOff. AllOn - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>ON</b>. AnyOn - Visible if any of the entries are <b>ON</b>. AnyOff - Visible if any of the entries are <b>OFF</b>. AllOff - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>OFF</b>. The default value is AnyOn.</div><pre>public void setVisibilityPolicy(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfName</a> visibilityPolicy)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayerMembership.html#setVisibilityPolicy-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-
PdfLineAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The purpose of a line annotation is to display a single straight line on the page. When opened, it displays a pop-up window containing the text of the associated note. See also ISO-320001 12.5.6.7 "Line Annotations".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getCaptionOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of two numbers that specifies the offset of the caption text from its normal position. The first value is the horizontal offset along the annotation line from its midpoint, with a positive value indicating offset to the right and a negative value indicating offset to the left. The second value is the vertical offset perpendicular to the annotation line, with a positive value indicating a shift up and a negative value indicating a shift down.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> getCaptionOffset()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getCaptionOffset--
PdfLineAnnotation getCaptionPosition	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A name describing the annotation's caption positioning. Valid values are <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Inline"><code>PdfName.Inline</code></a>, meaning the caption is centered inside the line, and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Top"><code>PdfName.Top</code></a>, meaning the caption is on top of the line.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfName</a> getCaptionPosition()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getCaptionPosition--
PdfLineAnnotation getContentsAsCaption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">If true, the text specified by the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Contents"><code>PdfName.Contents</code></a> or <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#RC"><code>PdfName.RC</code></a> entries (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getContents--"><code>PdfAnnotation.getContents()</code></a> and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#getRichText--"><code>PdfMarkupAnnotation.getRichText()</code></a>) is replicated as a caption in the appearance of the line.</div><pre>public boolean getContentsAsCaption()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getContentsAsCaption--
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span> <span class="deprecationComment">use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLineLength--"><code>getLeaderLineLength()</code></a> instead.</span></div><br><div class="block">The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>); a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div><pre><a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Deprecated.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">@Deprecated</a>public float getLeaderLine()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLine--
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLineExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A non-negative number that represents the length of leader line extensions that extend from the line proper 180 degrees from the leader lines.</div><pre>public float getLeaderLineExtension()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLineExtension--
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLineLength	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>); a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div><pre>public float getLeaderLineLength()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLineLength--

PdfLineAnnotation getLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of four numbers, [x1 y1 x2 y2], specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the line in default user space. If the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#LL"><code>PdfName.LL</code></a> (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLine--"><code>getLeaderLine()</code></a>) entry is present, this value represents the endpoints of the leader lines rather than the endpoints of the line itself.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> getLine()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--
PdfLineAnnotation getLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of two names specifying the line ending styles that is used in drawing the line. The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined, respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> array (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>. PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLineLength	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>); a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfLineAnnotation</a> setLeaderLineLength(float leaderLineLength)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLeaderLineLength-float-

PdfLineAnnotation setLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the line ending styles that are used in drawing the line. The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined, respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> array (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>. Possible values for styles are: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Square"><code>PdfName.Square</code></a> - A square filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Circle"><code>PdfName.Circle</code></a> - A circle filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Diamond"><code>PdfName.Diamond</code></a> - A diamond shape filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code></a> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a> style and     connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#None"><code>PdfName.None</code></a> - No line ending; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Butt"><code>PdfName.Butt</code></a> - A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ROpenArrow"><code>PdfName.ROpenArrow</code></a> - Two short lines in the reverse direction from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a>; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#RClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.RClosedArrow</code></a> - A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code></a>; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Slash"><code>PdfName.Slash</code></a> - A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself; </li></ul> see also ISO-320001, Table 176 "Line ending styles".</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfLineAnnotation</a> setLineEndingStyles(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> lineEndingStyles)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLineEndingStyles-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-

PdfMarkupAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a super class for the annotations which are defined as markup annotations because they are used primarily to mark up PDF documents. These annotations have text that appears as part of the annotation and may be displayed in other ways by a conforming reader, such as in a Comments pane. PdfMarkupAnnotation setExternalData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets an external data dictionary specifying data that shall be associated with the annotation. This dictionary should contain the following entries: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Type"><code>PdfName.Type</code></a> - (optional) If present, shall be <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ExData"><code>PdfName.ExData</code></a>.</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Subtype"><code>PdfName.Subtype</code></a> - (required) a name specifying the type of data that the markup annotation     shall be associated with. The only defined value is <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Markup3D"><code>PdfName.Markup3D</code></a>. Table 298 (ISO-320001)     lists the values that correspond to a subtype of Markup3D (See also <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/Pdf3DAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>Pdf3DAnnotation</code></a>).</li></ul></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfMarkupAnnotation</a> setExternalData(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfName</a> exData)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#setExternalData-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-

PdfMarkupAnnotation setIntent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a name describing the intent of the markup annotation. Intents allow conforming readers to distinguish between different uses and behaviors of a single markup annotation type. If this entry is not present or its value is the same as the annotation type, the annotation shall have no explicit intent and should behave in a generic manner in a conforming reader. <p> See ISO-320001, free text annotations (Table 174), line annotations (Table 175), polygon annotations (Table 178), and polyline annotations (Table 178) for the specific intent values for those types. </p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfMarkupAnnotation</a> setIntent(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfName</a> intent)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#setIntent-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-

PdfMcr isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagging/PdfMcr.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfMediaClipData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is a wrapper of media clip data dictionary that defines the data for a media object that can be played.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html
PdfMediaClipData flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html#flush--
PdfMediaClipData isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfMerger close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Closes the current document. It is a complete equivalent of calling <code>PdfDocument#close</code> on the PdfDocument passed to the constructor of this PdfMerger instance. This means that it is enough to call <i>close</i> either on passed PdfDocument or on this PdfMerger instance, but there is no need to call them both.</div><pre>public void close()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html#close--
PdfMerger merge	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method merges pages from the source document to the current one. <br/><br/> If <i>closeSourceDocuments</i> flag is set to <i>true</i> (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html#setCloseSourceDocuments-boolean-"><code>setCloseSourceDocuments(boolean)</code></a>), passed <code>PdfDocument</code> will be closed after pages are merged.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils">PdfMerger</a> merge(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDocument.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfDocument</a> from, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/List.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">List</a>&lt;<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Integer.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">Integer</a>&gt; pages)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html#merge-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-java.util.List-
PdfMerger setCloseSourceDocuments	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">If set to <i>true</i> then passed to the <i><code>PdfMerger#merge</code></i> method source documents will be closed immediately after merging specified pages into current document. If <i>false</i> - PdfDocuments are left open. Default value - <i>false</i>.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils">PdfMerger</a> setCloseSourceDocuments(boolean closeSourceDocuments)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html#setCloseSourceDocuments-boolean-

PdfObjectWrapper ensureObjectIsAddedToDocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Some wrappers use object's indirect reference to obtain the <code>PdfDocument</code> to which the object belongs to. For this matter, for these wrappers it is implicitly defined that they work with indirect objects only. Commonly these wrappers have two constructors: one with <code>PdfDocument</code> as parameter to create a new object, and the other one which wraps around the given <code>PdfObject</code>. This method should be used in the second type of constructors to ensure that wrapper will able to obtain the <code>PdfDocument</code> instance.</div><pre>protected static void ensureObjectIsAddedToDocument(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObject.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfObject</a> object)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#markObjectAsIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfObject-

PdfObjectWrapper isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected abstract boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfPKCS7	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class does all the processing related to signing and verifying a PKCS#7 signature.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html
PdfPKCS7 getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">When using authenticatedAttributes the authentication process is different. The document digest is generated and put inside the attribute. The signing is done over the DER encoded authenticatedAttributes. This method provides that encoding and the parameters must be exactly the same as in <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html#getEncodedPKCS7-byte:A-"><code>getEncodedPKCS7(byte[])</code></a>. <p> A simple example: <p><pre> Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance(); PdfPKCS7 pk7 = new PdfPKCS7(key, chain, null, "SHA1", null, false); MessageDigest messageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA1"); byte[] buf = new byte[8192]; int n; InputStream inp = sap.getRangeStream(); while ((n = inp.read(buf)) &gt; 0) {    messageDigest.update(buf, 0, n); } byte[] hash = messageDigest.digest(); byte[] sh = pk7.getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(hash, cal); pk7.update(sh, 0, sh.length); byte[] sg = pk7.getEncodedPKCS7(hash, cal); </pre></p></p></div><pre>public byte[] getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(byte[] secondDigest, byte[] ocsp, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Collection.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">Collection</a>&lt;byte[]&gt; crlBytes, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.CryptoStandard.html" title="enum in com.itextpdf.signatures">PdfSigner.CryptoStandard</a> sigtype)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html#getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes-byte:A-byte:A-java.util.Collection-com.itextpdf.signatures.PdfSigner.CryptoStandard-

PdfPage flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes page and it's content stream. <br><br> If the page belongs to the document which is tagged, page flushing also triggers flushing of the tags, which are considered to belong to the page. The logic that defines if the given tag (structure element) belongs to the page is the following: if all the marked content references (dictionary or number references), that are the descenders of the given structure element, belong to the current page - the tag is considered to belong to the page. If tag has descenders from several pages - it is flushed, if all other pages except the current one are flushed.</br></br></div><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#flush--

If page doesn't have resource object, then it will be inherited from page's parents. If neither parents nor page has the resource object, then the new one is created and added to page dictionary. <br/><br/> NOTE: If you'll try to modify the inherited resources, then the new resources object will be created, so you won't change the parent's resources. This new object under the wrapper will be added to page dictionary on <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#flush--"><code>flush()</code></a>, or you can add it manually with this line, if needed:<br/><code>getPdfObject().put(PdfName.Resources, getResources().getPdfObject());</code></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfResources.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfResources</a> getResources()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#getResources--

PdfPattern flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfPattern.html#flush--

PdfPattern isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfPattern.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfRendition flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfRendition isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfRendition.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with Coons Patch mesh type. This type of shading is constructed from one or more colour patches, each bounded by four cubic BÃ©zier curves. Degenerate BÃ©zier curves are allowed and are useful for certain graphical effects. At least one complete patch shall be specified. The shape of patch is defined by 12 control points. Colours are specified for each corner of the unit square, and bilinear interpolation is used to fill in colours over the entire unit square. Coordinates are mapped from the unit square into a four-sided patch whose sides are not necessarily linear. The mapping is continuous: the corners of the unit square map to corners of the patch and the sides of the unit square map to sides of the patch. For the format of data stream, that defines patches Table 85. If the shading dictionary contains a Function entry, the colour data for each corner of a patch shall be specified by a single parametric value t rather than by n separate colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html
PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh getBitsPerComponent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets the number of bits used to represent each colour component.</div><pre>public int getBitsPerComponent()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html#getBitsPerComponent--

PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh getBitsPerFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets the number of bits used to represent the edge flag for each vertex. But only the least significant 2 bits in each flag value shall be used. The valid flag values are 0, 1, 2 or 3.</div><pre>public int getBitsPerFlag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html#getBitsPerFlag--
PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh getDecode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>PdfArray</code></a> of numbers specifying how to map vertex coordinates and colour components into the appropriate ranges of values. The ranges shall be specified as follows: [x_min x_max y_min y_max c1_min c1_max â¦ cn_min cn_max]. Only one pair of color values shall be specified if a Function entry is present.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfArray</a> getDecode()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html#getDecode--

PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with free-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type. The area to be shaded is defined by a path composed entirely of triangles. The colour at each vertex of the triangles is specified, and a technique known as Gouraud interpolation is used to colour the interiors. The object shall be represented as stream containing a sequence of vertex data. Each vertex is specified by the following values, in the order shown: f x y c1 â¦ cn where: f -  the vertexâs edge flag, that determines the vertex is connected to other vertices of the triangle mesh.      For full description Paragph 8.7.4.5.5 x, y - vertexâs horizontal and vertical coordinates, expressed in the shadingâs target coordinate space. c1â¦cn - vertexâs colour components. If the shading dictionary includes a Function entry, only a single parametric value, t, shall be specified for each vertex in place of the colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with lattice-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type. This type is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh but instead of using free-form geometry, the vertices are arranged in a pseudorectangular lattice, which is topologically equivalent to a rectangular grid. The vertices are organized into rows, which need not be geometrically linear. The verticals data in stream is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh, except there is no edge flag.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfSigFieldLockDictionary isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Enumerates the different levels of access permissions granted for the document when the corresponding signature field is signed: NO_CHANGES_ALLOWED - no changes to the document are     permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature,FORM_FILLING - permitted changes are filling in forms,     instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate     the signature,FORM_FILLING_AND_ANNOTATION - permitted changes are the     same as for the previous, as well as annotation creation, deletion,     and modification; other changes invalidate the signature.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions.html

PdfSignatureAppearance setImageScale	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the scaling to be applied to the background image. If it's zero the image will fully fill the rectangle. If it's less than zero the image will fill the rectangle but will keep the proportions. If it's greater than zero that scaling will be applied. In any of the cases the image will always be centered. It's zero by default.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignatureAppearance.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.signatures">PdfSignatureAppearance</a> setImageScale(float imageScale)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignatureAppearance.html#setImageScale-float-

PdfSignatureBuildProperties isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignatureBuildProperties.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

The general sequence is: preClose(), getDocumentBytes() and close(). <p> update is a PdfDictionary that must have exactly the same keys as the ones provided in <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#preClose-java.util.Map-"><code>preClose(Map)</code></a>.</p></div><pre>protected void close(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDictionary.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfDictionary</a> update) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#close-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDictionary-

PdfSigner getSignatureAppearance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Provides access to a signature appearance object. Use it to customize the appearance of the signature. <p> Be aware: <ul><li>If you create new signature field (either use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#setFieldName-java.lang.String-"><code>setFieldName(java.lang.String)</code></a> with the name that doesn't exist in the document or don't specify it at all) then the signature is invisible by default.</li><li>If you sign already existing field, then the signature appearance object is modified to have all the properties (page num., rect etc.) consistent with the state of the field (<strong>if you customized the appearance object before the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#setFieldName-java.lang.String-"><code>setFieldName(java.lang.String)</code></a> call you'll have to do it again</strong>)</li></ul></p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignatureAppearance.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.signatures">PdfSignatureAppearance</a> getSignatureAppearance()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#getSignatureAppearance--

PdfSigner preClose	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This is the first method to be called when using external signatures.
