PdfSpecialCs flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfSpecialCs.html#flush--
PdfSpecialCs isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfSpecialCs.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PdfString-class is the PDF-equivalent of a JAVA-String-object.  A string is a sequence of characters delimited by parenthesis. If a string is too long to be conveniently placed on a single line, it may be split across multiple lines by using the backslash character (\) at the end of a line to indicate that the string continues on the following line. Within a string, the backslash character is used as an escape to specify unbalanced parenthesis, non-printing ASCII characters, and the backslash character itself. Use of the \ddd escape sequence is the preferred way to represent characters outside the printable ASCII character set. This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual version 1.7' section 3.2.3 (page 53-56). PdfObject</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfString.html

PdfStringDestination isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/navigation/PdfStringDestination.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfStructTreeRoot isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagging/PdfStructTreeRoot.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--
PdfTargetDictionary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A target dictionary locates the target in relation to the source, in much the same way that a relative path describes the physical relationship between two files in a file system. Target dictionaries may be nested recursively to specify one or more intermediate targets before reaching the final one.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfTargetDictionary.html

PdfTextArray	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfTextArray defines an array with displacements and PdfString-objects.  A PdfTextArray is used with the operator TJ in PdfCanvas. The first object in this array has to be a PdfString; see reference manual version 1.3 section 8.7.5, pages 346-347.       OR see reference manual version 1.6 section 5.3.2, pages 378-379. To emit a more efficient array, we consolidate repeated numbers or strings into single array entries. "add( 50 ); add( -50 );" will REMOVE the combined zero from the array.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfTextArray.html

PdfTextMarkupAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfTextMarkupAnnotation.html
PdfTextMarkupAnnotation createHighLight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a text markup annotation of highlight style subtype. <p> IMPORTANT NOTE on <b>quadPoints</b> argument: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div><pre>public static <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfTextMarkupAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfTextMarkupAnnotation</a> createHighLight(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/Rectangle.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.geom">Rectangle</a> rect, float[] quadPoints)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfTextMarkupAnnotation.html#createHighLight-com.itextpdf.kernel.geom.Rectangle-float:A-

This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfType3Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Low-level API class for Type 3 fonts.  In Type 3 fonts, glyphs are defined by streams of PDF graphics operators. These streams are associated with character names. A separate encoding entry maps character codes to the appropriate character names for the glyphs.  To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/font/PdfType3Font.html

PdfViewerPreferences isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfViewerPreferences.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

RandomAccessFileOrArray readCharLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads a Unicode character from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads two bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (char)((b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1) </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div><pre>public final char readCharLE() throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readCharLE--

RandomAccessFileOrArray readIntLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads a signed 32-bit integer from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads 4 bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code>, <code>b2</code>, <code>b3</code>, and <code>b4</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2, b3, b4 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (b4 &lt;&lt; 24) | (b3 &lt;&lt; 16) + (b2 &lt;&lt; 8) + b1 </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the four bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div><pre>public final int readIntLE() throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readIntLE--

RandomAccessFileOrArray readShortLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads a signed 16-bit number from this stream in little-endian order. The method reads two bytes from this stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the two bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where each of the two values is between <code>0</code> and <code>255</code>, inclusive, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (short)((b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1) </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div><pre>public final short readShortLE() throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readShortLE--

RandomAccessSourceFactory	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Factory to create IRandomAccessSource objects based on various types of sources</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html
RandomAccessSourceFactory createBestSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a> based on a filename string. If the filename describes a URL, a URL based source is created If the filename describes a file on disk, the contents may be read into memory (if <code>forceRead</code> is true), opened using memory mapped file channel (if usePlainRandomAccess is false), or opened using <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/RandomAccessFile.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io"><code>RandomAccessFile</code></a> access (if usePlainRandomAccess is true) This call will automatically fail over to using <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/RandomAccessFile.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io"><code>RandomAccessFile</code></a> if the memory map operation fails</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source">IRandomAccessSource</a> createBestSource(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> filename) throws <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io">IOException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html#createBestSource-java.lang.String-

RandomAccessSourceFactory createSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a> based on an <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/InputStream.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io"><code>InputStream</code></a>. RootRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#draw-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DrawContext-"><code>IRenderer.draw(DrawContext)</code></a>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutResult</a> layout(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutContext</a> layoutContext)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/RootRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

RoundDotsBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div><pre>public void draw(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas">PdfCanvas</a> canvas, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float borderWidthBefore, float borderWidthAfter)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/RoundDotsBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

SolidBorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Draws a solid border around the element it's set to.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/SolidBorder.html
SolidBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div><pre>public void draw(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas">PdfCanvas</a> canvas, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float borderWidthBefore, float borderWidthAfter)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/SolidBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

TIFFConstants	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A list of constants used in class TIFFImage.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFConstants.html
TIFFDirectory	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A class representing an Image File Directory (IFD) from a TIFF 6.0 stream.  The TIFF file format is described in more detail in the comments for the TIFFDescriptor class.  A TIFF IFD consists of a set of TIFFField tags.  Methods are provided to query the set of tags and to obtain the raw field array.  In addition, convenience methods are provided for acquiring the values of tags that contain a single value that fits into a byte, int, long, float, or double.  Every TIFF file is made up of one or more public IFDs that are joined in a linked list, rooted in the file header.  A file may also contain so-called private IFDs that are referenced from tag data and do not appear in the main list.  This class is not a committed part of the JAI API.  It may be removed or changed in future releases of JAI.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFDirectory.html
TIFFDirectory getField	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns the value of a given tag as a TIFFField, or null if the tag is not present.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.io.codec">TIFFField</a> getField(int tag)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFDirectory.html#getField-int-
TIFFDirectory getFieldAsByte	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns the value of a particular index of a given tag as a byte.  The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has type TIFFField.TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_BYTE, or TIFF_UNDEFINED.</div><pre>public byte getFieldAsByte(int tag, int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFDirectory.html#getFieldAsByte-int-int-

TIFFField	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A class representing a field in a TIFF 6.0 Image File Directory.  The TIFF file format is described in more detail in the comments for the TIFFDescriptor class.  A field in a TIFF Image File Directory (IFD).  A field is defined as a sequence of values of identical data type.  TIFF 6.0 defines 12 data types, which are mapped internally onto the Java data types byte, int, long, float, and double.  This class is not a committed part of the JAI API.  It may be removed or changed in future releases of JAI.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html
TIFFField compareTo	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares this <code>TIFFField</code> with another <code>TIFFField</code> by comparing the tags. <p><b>Note: this class has a natural ordering that is inconsistent with <code>equals()</code>.</b></p></div><pre>public int compareTo(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.io.codec">TIFFField</a> o)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#compareTo-com.itextpdf.io.codec.TIFFField-
TIFFField getAsBytes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns the data as an uninterpreted array of bytes. The type of the field must be one of TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, or TIFF_UNDEFINED; <p> For data in TIFF_BYTE format, the application must take care when promoting the data to longer integral types to avoid sign extension. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, or TIFF_UNDEFINED.</p></p></div><pre>public byte[] getAsBytes()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsBytes--
TIFFField getAsChars	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns TIFF_SHORT data as an array of chars (unsigned 16-bit integers). <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_SHORT.</p></div><pre>public char[] getAsChars()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsChars--
TIFFField getAsDouble	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns data in any numerical format as a float.  Data in TIFF_SRATIONAL or TIFF_RATIONAL format are evaluated by dividing the numerator into the denominator using double-precision arithmetic. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is of type TIFF_UNDEFINED or TIFF_ASCII.</p></div><pre>public double getAsDouble(int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsDouble-int-
TIFFField getAsDoubles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns TIFF_DOUBLE data as an array of doubles. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_DOUBLE.</p></div><pre>public double[] getAsDoubles()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsDoubles--
TIFFField getAsFloat	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns data in any numerical format as a float.  Data in TIFF_SRATIONAL or TIFF_RATIONAL format are evaluated by dividing the numerator into the denominator using double-precision arithmetic and then truncating to single precision.  Data in TIFF_SLONG, TIFF_LONG, or TIFF_DOUBLE format may suffer from truncation. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is of type TIFF_UNDEFINED or TIFF_ASCII.</p></div><pre>public float getAsFloat(int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsFloat-int-
TIFFField getAsFloats	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns TIFF_FLOAT data as an array of floats. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_FLOAT.</p></div><pre>public float[] getAsFloats()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsFloats--
TIFFField getAsInt	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns data in TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, or TIFF_SLONG format as an int. <p> TIFF_BYTE and TIFF_UNDEFINED data are treated as unsigned; that is, no sign extension will take place and the returned value will be in the range [0, 255].  TIFF_SBYTE data will be returned in the range [-128, 127]. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, or TIFF_SLONG.</p></p></div><pre>public int getAsInt(int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsInt-int-
TIFFField getAsInts	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns TIFF_SLONG data as an array of ints (signed 32-bit integers). <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_SLONG.</p></div><pre>public int[] getAsInts()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsInts--
TIFFField getAsLong	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns data in TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, TIFF_SLONG, or TIFF_LONG format as a long. <p> TIFF_BYTE and TIFF_UNDEFINED data are treated as unsigned; that is, no sign extension will take place and the returned value will be in the range [0, 255].  TIFF_SBYTE data will be returned in the range [-128, 127]. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, TIFF_SLONG, or TIFF_LONG.</p></p></div><pre>public long getAsLong(int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsLong-int-

TabRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from interface: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-">IRenderer</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#draw-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DrawContext-"><code>IRenderer.draw(DrawContext)</code></a>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutResult</a> layout(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout">LayoutContext</a> layoutContext)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TabRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

Table	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Table is a layout element that represents data in a two-dimensional grid. It is filled with cells, ordered in rows and columns.  It is an implementation of ILargeElement, which means it can be flushed to the canvas, in order to reclaim memory that is locked up.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html

Table calculateWidths	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>protected void calculateWidths()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#calculateWidths--
Table complete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Indicates that all the desired content has been added to this large element. After this method is called, more precise rendering is activated. For instance, a table may have a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#setSkipLastFooter-boolean-"><code>setSkipLastFooter(boolean)</code></a> method set to true, and in case of large table on <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#flush--"><code>flush()</code></a> we do not know if any more content will be added, so we might not place the content in the bottom of the page where it would fit, but instead add a footer, and place that content in the start of the page. Technically such result would look all right, but it would be more concise if we placed the content in the bottom and did not start new page. For such cases to be renderered more accurately, one can call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#complete--"><code>complete()</code></a> when some content is still there and not flushed.</div><pre>public void complete()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#complete--
Table createRendererSubTree	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a renderer subtree with root in the current table element. Compared to <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#getRenderer--"><code>getRenderer()</code></a>, the renderer returned by this method should contain all the child renderers for children of the current element.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer">IRenderer</a> createRendererSubTree()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#createRendererSubTree--

TableRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. TagStructureContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TagStructureContext class is used to track necessary information of document's tag structure. It is also used to make some global modifications of the tag tree like removing or flushing page tags, however these two methods and also others are called automatically and are for the most part for internal usage.  There shall be only one instance of this class per PdfDocument. To obtain instance of this class use PdfDocument.getTagStructureContext().</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html
TagStructureContext actualizeTagsProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Method for internal usages. Essentially, all it does is just making sure that for connected tags properties are up to date with connected accessible elements properties.</div><pre>public void actualizeTagsProperties()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#actualizeTagsProperties--
TagStructureContext flushPageTags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes the tags which are considered to belong to the given page. The logic that defines if the given tag (structure element) belongs to the page is the following: if all the marked content references (dictionary or number references), that are the descenders of the given structure element, belong to the current page - the tag is considered to belong to the page. If tag has descenders from several pages - it is flushed, if all other pages except the current one are flushed. <br><br> If some of the page's tags are still connected to the accessible elements, in this case these tags are considered as not yet finished ones, and they won't be flushed.</br></br></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagStructureContext</a> flushPageTags(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfPage</a> page)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#flushPageTags-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-
TagStructureContext getAutoTaggingPointer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">All document auto tagging logic uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils"><code>TagTreePointer</code></a> returned by this method to manipulate tag structure. Typically it points at the root tag. This pointer also could be used to tweak auto tagging process (e.g. move this pointer to the Sect tag, which would result in placing all automatically tagged content under Sect tag).</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> getAutoTaggingPointer()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#getAutoTaggingPointer--

TagStructureContext normalizeDocumentRootTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Transforms root tags in a way that complies with the PDF References. <br/><br/> PDF Reference 10.7.3 Grouping Elements: <br/><br/> For most content extraction formats, the document must be a tree with a single top-level element; the structure tree root (identified by the StructTreeRoot entry in the document catalog) must have only one child in its K (kids) array. If the PDF file contains a complete document, the structure type Document is recommended for this top-level element in the logical structure hierarchy. If the file contains a well-formed document fragment, one of the structure types Part, Art, Sect, or Div may be used instead.</div><pre>public void normalizeDocumentRootTag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#normalizeDocumentRootTag--

TagStructureContext removePageTags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Removes all tags that belong only to this page. The logic which defines if tag belongs to the page is described at <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#flushPageTags-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-"><code>flushPageTags(PdfPage)</code></a>.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagStructureContext</a> removePageTags(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfPage</a> page)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#removePageTags-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-
TagStructureContext setForbidUnknownRoles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">If forbidUnknownRoles is set to true, then if you would try to add new tag which has not a standard role and it's role is not mapped through RoleMap, an exception will be raised. Default value - true.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagStructureContext</a> setForbidUnknownRoles(boolean forbidUnknownRoles)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#setForbidUnknownRoles-boolean-
TagTreePointer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TagTreePointer class is used to modify the document's tag tree. At any given moment, instance of this class 'points' at the specific position in the tree (at the specific tag). For the current tag you can add new tags, modify it's role and properties, etc. Also, using instance of this class, you can change tag position in the tag structure, you can flush current tag or remove it.  There could be any number of the instances of this class, simultaneously pointing to different (or the same) parts of the tag structure. Because of this, you can for example remove the tag at which another instance is currently pointing. In this case, this another instance becomes invalid, and invocation of any method on it will result in exception. To make given instance valid again, use moveToRoot() method.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html
TagTreePointer addAnnotationTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Adds a new content item for the given <code>PdfAnnotation</code> under the current tag. <br/><br/> By default, when annotation is added to the page it is automatically tagged with auto tagging pointer (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#getAutoTaggingPointer--"><code>TagStructureContext.getAutoTaggingPointer()</code></a>). If you want to add annotation tag manually, be sure to use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#addAnnotation-int-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot.PdfAnnotation-boolean-"><code>PdfPage.addAnnotation(int, PdfAnnotation, boolean)</code></a> method with <i>false</i> for boolean flag.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> addAnnotationTag(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot">PdfAnnotation</a> annotation)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#addAnnotationTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot.PdfAnnotation-
TagTreePointer addTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Adds a new tag to the tag structure. This method call moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> to the added kid. <br/> New tag will have a role and attributes defined by the given IAccessibleElement. <br><br> If  is true then a newly created tag will retain the connection with given accessible element. See <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#moveToTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement-"><code>moveToTag(com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement)</code></a> for more explanations about tag connections concept. <br/><br/> If the same accessible element is connected to the tag and is added twice to the same parent - this <code>TagTreePointer</code> instance would move to connected kid instead of creating tag twice. But if it is added to some other parent, then connection will be removed. <p><br/><br/> This call is equivalent of calling sequentially <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setNextNewKidIndex-int-"><code>setNextNewKidIndex(int)</code></a> and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#addTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement-boolean-"><code>addTag(IAccessibleElement, boolean)</code></a>.</p></br></br></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> addTag(int index, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/IAccessibleElement.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">IAccessibleElement</a> element, boolean keepConnectedToTag)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#addTag-int-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement-boolean-
TagTreePointer flushTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes the current tag and all it's descenders. This method call moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> to the current tag parent. <p><br><br> If some of the tags to be flushed are still connected to the accessible elements, then these tags are considered as not yet finished ones, and they won't be flushed immediately, but they will be flushed, when the connection is removed.</br></br></p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> flushTag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#flushTag--

TagTreePointer moveToTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> instance to a tag, which is connected with the given accessible element. <p><br/><br/> The connection between the tag and the accessible element instance is used as a sign that tag is not yet finished and therefore should not be flushed or removed if page tags are flushed or removed. Also, any <code>TagTreePointer</code> could be immediately moved to the tag with connection via it's connected element by using this method. If accessible element is connected to the tag, then all changes of the role or properties of the element will affect the connected tag role and properties. <br/> For any existing not connected tag the connection could be created using <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#getConnectedElement-boolean-"><code>getConnectedElement(boolean)</code></a> with <i>true</i> as parameter.</p></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> moveToTag(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/IAccessibleElement.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">IAccessibleElement</a> element)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#moveToTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement-

This method doesn't change pointerToNewParent position.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> relocateKid(int kidIndex, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> pointerToNewParent)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#relocateKid-int-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.TagTreePointer-
TagTreePointer removeElementConnectionToTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Destroys the connection between the given accessible element and the tag to which this element is connected to. TagTreePointer removeTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Removes the current tag. If it has kids, they will become kids of the current tag parent. This method call moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> to the current tag parent. <br/><br/> You cannot remove root tag, and also you cannot remove any tag if document's tag structure was partially flushed; in this two cases an exception will be thrown.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> removeTag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#removeTag--
TagTreePointer setContentStreamForTagging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sometimes, tags are desired to be connected with the content that resides not in the page's content stream, but rather in the some appearance stream or in the form xObject stream. In that case, to have a valid tag structure, one shall set not only the page, on which the content will be rendered, but also the content stream in which the tagged content will reside. <br><br> NOTE: It's important to set a <code>null</code> for this value, when tagging of this stream content is finished.</br></br></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> setContentStreamForTagging(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfStream.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfStream</a> contentStream)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setContentStreamForTagging-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfStream-
TagTreePointer setNextNewKidIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets index of the next added to the current tag kid, which could be another tag or content item. By default, new tag is added at the end of the parent kids array. This property affects only the next added tag, all tags added after will be added with the default behaviour. <br/><br/> This method could be used with any overload of <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#addTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-"><code>addTag(PdfName)</code></a> method, with <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#relocateKid-int-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.TagTreePointer-"><code>relocateKid(int, TagTreePointer)</code></a> and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#addAnnotationTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot.PdfAnnotation-"><code>addAnnotationTag(PdfAnnotation)</code></a>. <br/> Keep in mind, that this method set property to the <code>TagTreePointer</code> and not to the tag itself, which means that if you would move the pointer, this property would be applied to the new current tag.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> setNextNewKidIndex(int nextNewKidIndex)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setNextNewKidIndex-int-
TagTreePointer setPageForTagging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a page which content will be tagged with this instance of <code>TagTreePointer</code>. To tag page content: <ol><li>Set pointer position to the tag which will be the parent of the page content item;</li><li>Call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#getTagReference--"><code>getTagReference()</code></a> to obtain the reference to the current tag;</li><li>Pass <code>PdfTagReference</code> to the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html#openTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.TagReference-"><code>PdfCanvas.openTag(TagReference)</code></a> method of the page's <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas"><code>PdfCanvas</code></a> to start marked content item;</li><li>Draw content on <code>PdfCanvas</code>;</li><li>Use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html#closeTag--"><code>PdfCanvas.closeTag()</code></a> to finish marked content item.</li></ol></div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils">TagTreePointer</a> setPageForTagging(<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">PdfPage</a> page)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setPageForTagging-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-

TernaryTree	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Ternary Search Tree.A ternary search tree is a hibrid between a binary tree and a digital search tree (trie). Keys are limited to strings. A data value of type char is stored in each leaf node. It can be used as an index (or pointer) to the data. Branches that only contain one key are compressed to one node by storing a pointer to the trailer substring of the key. This class is intended to serve as base class or helper class to implement Dictionary collections or the like. Ternary trees have some nice properties as the following: the tree can be traversed in sorted order, partial matches (wildcard) can be implemented, retrieval of all keys within a given distance from the target, etc. The storage requirements are higher than a binary tree but a lot less than a trie. Performance is comparable with a hash table, sometimes it outperforms a hash function (most of the time can determine a miss faster than a hash).The main purpose of this java port is to serve as a base for implementing TeX's hyphenation algorithm (see The TeXBook, appendix H). Each language requires from 5000 to 15000 hyphenation patterns which will be keys in this tree. The strings patterns are usually small (from 2 to 5 characters), but each char in the tree is stored in a node. Thus memory usage is the main concern. We will sacrify 'elegance' to keep memory requirements to the minimum. Using java's char type as pointer (yes, I know pointer it is a forbidden word in java) we can keep the size of the node to be just 8 bytes (3 pointers and the data char). This gives room for about 65000 nodes. In my tests the english patterns took 7694 nodes and the german patterns 10055 nodes, so I think we are safe.All said, this is a map with strings as keys and char as value. Pretty limited!. It can be extended to a general map by using the string representation of an object and using the char value as an index to an array that contains the object values.This work was authored by Carlos Villegas (cav@uniscope.co.jp).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html

TernaryTree insert	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Branches are initially compressed, needing one node per key plus the size of the string key. They are decompressed as needed when another key with same prefix is inserted. This saves a lot of space, specially for long keys.</div><pre>public void insert(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> key, char val)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html#insert-java.lang.String-char-

The array of keys is assumed to be sorted in ascending order.</div><pre>protected void insertBalanced(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a>[] k, char[] v, int offset, int n)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html#insertBalanced-java.lang.String:A-char:A-int-int-

TernaryTree trimToSize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Each node stores a character (splitchar) which is part of some key(s). In a compressed branch (one that only contain a single string key) the trailer of the key which is not already in nodes is stored  externally in the kv array. As items are inserted, key substrings decrease. Some substrings may completely  disappear when the whole branch is totally decompressed. The tree is traversed to find the key substrings actually used. In addition, duplicate substrings are removed using a map (implemented with a TernaryTree!).</div><pre>public void trimToSize()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html#trimToSize--

Utils normalizeLangValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Normalize an xml:lang value so that comparisons are effectively case insensitive as required by RFC 3066 (which superceeds RFC 1766). The normalization rules: <ul><li> The primary subtag is lower case, the suggested practice of ISO 639. <li> All 2 letter secondary subtags are upper case, the suggested practice of ISO 3166. <li> All other subtags are lower case. </li></li></li></ul></div><pre>public static <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> normalizeLangValue(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> value)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/Utils.html#normalizeLangValue-java.lang.String-

For many PDF related operations, the z coordinate is specified as 1 This is to support the coordinate transformation calculations. WriterProperties setPublicKeyEncryption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the certificate encryption options for the document. An array of one or more public certificates must be provided together with an array of the same size for the permissions for each certificate. The open permissions for the document can be AllowPrinting, AllowModifyContents, AllowCopy, AllowModifyAnnotations, AllowFillIn, AllowScreenReaders, AllowAssembly and AllowDegradedPrinting. The permissions can be combined by ORing them. Optionally DO_NOT_ENCRYPT_METADATA can be ored to output the metadata in cleartext See <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionConstants.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>EncryptionConstants</code></a>.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">WriterProperties</a> setPublicKeyEncryption(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/security/cert/Certificate.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.security.cert">Certificate</a>[] certs, int[] permissions, int encryptionAlgorithm)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html#setPublicKeyEncryption-java.security.cert.Certificate:A-int:A-int-
WriterProperties setStandardEncryption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the encryption options for the document. The userPassword and the ownerPassword can be null or have zero length. In this case the ownerPassword is replaced by a random string. The open permissions for the document can be AllowPrinting, AllowModifyContents, AllowCopy, AllowModifyAnnotations, AllowFillIn, AllowScreenReaders, AllowAssembly and AllowDegradedPrinting. The permissions can be combined by ORing them. See <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionConstants.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>EncryptionConstants</code></a>.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">WriterProperties</a> setStandardEncryption(byte[] userPassword, byte[] ownerPassword, int permissions, int encryptionAlgorithm)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html#setStandardEncryption-byte:A-byte:A-int-int-
WriterProperties useDebugMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This activates debug mode with pdfDebug tool. It causes additional overhead of duplicating document bytes into memory, so use it careful. NEVER use it in production or in any other cases except pdfDebug.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">WriterProperties</a> useDebugMode()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html#useDebugMode--
WriterProperties useSmartMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Enables smart mode. <p></p> In smart mode when resources (such as fonts, images,...) are encountered, a reference to these resources is saved in a cache, so that they can be reused. This requires more memory, but reduces the file size of the resulting PDF document.</div><pre>public <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf">WriterProperties</a> useSmartMode()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html#useSmartMode--

XMPConst	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Common constants for the XMP Toolkit.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPConst.html
XMPDateTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The XMPDateTime-class represents a point in time up to a resolution of nano seconds. Dates and time in the serialized XMP are ISO 8601 strings. There are utility functions to convert to the ISO format, a Calendar or get the Timezone. The fields of XMPDateTime are:  month - The month in the range 1..12.  day - The day of the month in the range 1..31.  minute - The minute in the range 0..59.  hour - The time zone hour in the range 0..23.  minute - The time zone minute in the range 0..59.  nanoSecond - The nano seconds within a second. Note: if the XMPDateTime is converted into a calendar, the resolution is reduced to milli seconds.  timeZone - a TimeZone-object.  DateTime values are occasionally used in cases with only a date or only a time component. A date without a time has zeros for all the time fields. A time without a date has zeros for all date fields (year, month, and day).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPDateTime.html

XMPException getErrorCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>public int getErrorCode()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPException.html#getErrorCode--
XMPIterator	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Interface for the XMPMeta iteration services. XMPIterator provides a uniform means to iterate over the schema and properties within an XMP object.  The iteration over the schema and properties within an XMP object is very complex. It is helpful to have a thorough understanding of the XMP data tree. One way to learn this is to create some complex XMP and examine the output of XMPMeta#toString. This is also described in the XMP Specification, in the XMP Data Model chapter.  The top of the XMP data tree is a single root node. This does not explicitly appear in the dump and is never visited by an iterator (that is, it is never returned from XMPIterator#next()). Beneath the root are schema nodes. These are just collectors for top level properties in the same namespace. They are created and destroyed implicitly. Beneath the schema nodes are the property nodes. The nodes below a property node depend on its type (simple, struct, or array) and whether it has qualifiers.  An XMPIterator is created by XMPMeta#interator() constructor defines a starting point for the iteration and options that control how it proceeds. By default the iteration starts at the root and visits all nodes beneath it in a depth first manner. The root node is not visited, the first visited node is a schema node. You can provide a schema name or property path to select a different starting node. By default this visits the named root node first then all nodes beneath it in a depth first manner.  The XMPIterator#next() method delivers the schema URI, path, and option flags for the node being visited. If the node is simple it also delivers the value. Qualifiers for this node are visited next. The fields of a struct or items of an array are visited after the qualifiers of the parent.  The options to control the iteration are: JUST_CHILDREN - Visit just the immediate children of the root. Skip the root itself and all nodes below the immediate children. This omits the qualifiers of the immediate children, the qualifier nodes being below what they qualify, default is to visit the complete subtree. JUST_LEAFNODES - Visit just the leaf property nodes and their qualifiers. JUST_LEAFNAME - Return just the leaf component of the node names. The default is to return the full xmp path. OMIT_QUALIFIERS - Do not visit the qualifiers. INCLUDE_ALIASES - Adds known alias properties to the properties in the iteration.                Note: Not supported in Java XMPCore!  next() returns XMPPropertyInfo-objects and throws a NoSuchElementException if there are no more properties to return.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPIterator.html

During the iteration the XMPMeta-object must not be changed. Calls to skipSubtree() / skipSiblings() will affect the iteration.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/XMPIteratorImpl.html

XMPMeta getLocalizedText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">These functions provide convenient support for localized text properties, including a number of special and obscure aspects. Localized text properties are stored in alt-text arrays. They allow multiple concurrent localizations of a property value, for example a document title or copyright in several languages. The most important aspect of these functions is that they select an appropriate array item based on one or two RFC 3066 language tags. One of these languages, the "specific" language, is preferred and selected if there is an exact match. For many languages it is also possible to define a "generic" language that may be used if there is no specific language match. The generic language must be a valid RFC 3066 primary subtag, or the empty string. For example, a specific language of "en-US" should be used in the US, and a specific language of "en-UK" should be used in England. It is also appropriate to use "en" as the generic language in each case. If a US document goes to England, the "en-US" title is selected by using the "en" generic language and the "en-UK" specific language. It is considered poor practice, but allowed, to pass a specific language that is just an RFC 3066 primary tag. For example "en" is not a good specific language, it should only be used as a generic language. Passing "i" or "x" as the generic language is also considered poor practice but allowed. Advice from the W3C about the use of RFC 3066 language tags can be found at: http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/ <p><em>Note:</em> RFC 3066 language tags must be treated in a case insensitive manner. The XMP Toolkit does this by normalizing their capitalization: <ul><li> The primary subtag is lower case, the suggested practice of ISO 639. <li> All 2 letter secondary subtags are upper case, the suggested practice of ISO 3166. <li> All other subtags are lower case. The XMP specification defines an artificial language, <li>"x-default", that is used to explicitly denote a default item in an alt-text array. </li></li></li></li></ul> The XMP toolkit normalizes alt-text arrays such that the x-default item is the first item. The SetLocalizedText function has several special features related to the x-default item, see its description for details. The selection of the array item is the same for GetLocalizedText and SetLocalizedText: <ul><li> Look for an exact match with the specific language. <li> If a generic language is given, look for a partial match. <li> Look for an x-default item. <li> Choose the first item. </li></li></li></li></ul> A partial match with the generic language is where the start of the item's language matches the generic string and the next character is '-'. An exact match is also recognized as a degenerate case. It is fine to pass x-default as the specific language. In this case, selection of an x-default item is an exact match by the first rule, not a selection by the 3rd rule. The last 2 rules are fallbacks used when the specific and generic languages fail to produce a match. <code>getLocalizedText</code> returns information about a selected item in an alt-text array. The array item is selected according to the rules given above. <em>Note:</em> In a future version of this API a method                using Java <code>java.lang.Locale</code> will be added.</p></div><pre><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/properties/XMPProperty.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.properties">XMPProperty</a> getLocalizedText(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> schemaNS, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> altTextName, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> genericLang, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> specificLang) throws <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPException.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp">XMPException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPMeta.html#getLocalizedText-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-
XMPMeta getObjectName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This correlates to the about-attribute, returns the empty String if no name is set.</div><pre><a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> getObjectName()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPMeta.html#getObjectName--
XMPMeta getPacketHeader	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre><a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> getPacketHeader()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPMeta.html#getPacketHeader--
XMPMeta getProperty	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">The property value getter-methods all take a property specification: the first two parameters are always the top level namespace URI (the "schema" namespace) and the basic name of the property being referenced. See the introductory discussion of path expression usage for more information. <p> All of the functions return an object inherited from <code>PropertyBase</code> or <code>null</code> if the property does not exists. The result object contains the value of the property and option flags describing the property. Arrays and the non-leaf levels of nodes do not have values. <p> See <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/options/PropertyOptions.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.options"><code>PropertyOptions</code></a> for detailed information about the options. <p> This is the simplest property getter, mainly for top level simple properties or after using the path composition functions in XMPPathFactory.</p></p></p></div><pre><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/properties/XMPProperty.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.properties">XMPProperty</a> getProperty(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> schemaNS, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> propName) throws <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPException.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp">XMPException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPMeta.html#getProperty-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-
XMPMeta getPropertyBase64	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Convenience method to retrieve the literal value of a property.</div><pre>byte[] getPropertyBase64(<a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> schemaNS, <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a> propName) throws <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPException.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp">XMPException</a></pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPMeta.html#getPropertyBase64-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-
XMPMeta getPropertyBoolean	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">These are very similar to <code>getProperty()</code> and <code>SetProperty()</code> above, but the value is returned or provided in a literal form instead of as a UTF-8 string.
